channel.title: Microsoft ignores Windows 7 vulberability
channel.description:
Microsoft has known about this for half a year as well as indirectly acknowledged and ignored this vulnerability, I have asked Leo Davidson to release the proof-of-concept source code and test application into the wild for public scrutiny. If Microsoft is right in saying this has no security implications, then this should mean nothing. If they are not then, well, at least there is still time to do something about it. A month to be exact.
tl;dr:
A security hole in Windows 7, highlighted by a blogger back in January, is still wide open and Microsoft is showing very little interest in closing it.
sauce: http://www.istartedsomething.com/20090613/windows-7-uac-code-injection-vulnerability-video-demonstration-source-code-released/

item.title: Microsoft ignores Windows 7 vulberability
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Sorry, but that guy is an idiot. A total fucking idiot

I won't even bother asking WHY this has to happen. Who KNOWS why the color scheme of my entire OPERATING SYSTEM has to change when I run a particular program.

uh, because it had to disable dwm to run a legacy application that was designed for a window manage 2-3 generations ago. a perfectly valid reason, and it re-enables dwm after you close the offending application

An operating system doesn't HAVE to include image editors, sound editors, movie editors, games, word processors, or even web browsers. It DOES have to include the ability to see your files, though.

it does. it dosent have to let you unrar them though, go get winrar you lazy shit

then he goes on about how while running as a user he gets an elevated permissions request when trying to do something that requires administrator - no shit?

seriously, are capable computer users supposed to swallow this bullshit?

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft ignores Windows 7 vulberability
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Fat Cookies:

How can you be so fucking ignorant. UAC was a stupid idea in the first place, XP never had it and everyone loves the operating system,

The fact that XP never had a proper privilege system was the reason it was so insecure. UAC is a fine idea.

item.title: Microsoft ignores Windows 7 vulberability
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:19, topic:284200”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=375647.msg2832003#msg2832003 date=1245430598]
99.99% of pre-built pcs from big name companies like Pc World etc. all come with vista already installed, I think dell used to do pcs with XP on them, but I’m not too sure any more. But its pretty rare finding a pre-built pc with XP installed on it.
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure Dell will offer XP or ubuntu as an alternative.[/quote]
When I bought my Laptop I could choose without OS at all, so there is option, but in the most shops Windows Vista is the only option if you don’t want a netbook.

item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:16, topic:284200”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=375647.msg2831969#msg2831969 date=1245428467]

Windows 7 is only RC and not finished thats why there is exploits like this.

Topic: Microsoft ignores Windows 7 vulnerability.
Its not the bug that we are pissed off at, its Microsoft’s ignorance and stupid attitude.

They can’t afford another Vista, so a fix will come even if they are ignored it for a while.

Why?, people still bought it.

Vista was very unpopular and it was bundled with most PCs so people had no chooose.
[/quote]
99.99% of pre-built pcs from big name companies like Pc World etc. all come with vista already installed, I think dell used to do pcs with XP on them, but I’m not too sure any more. But its pretty rare finding a pre-built pc with XP installed on it.[/quote]
tonnes of PCs still come with XP installed, we had a choice of about 20 in our price range for the new IT room at school

item.description:

nobody uses uac so it doesnt matter

Windows 7 UAC is much better, now I never notice it.(Remember change the UAC settings)

If its so much better, why is there exploits like this?

Vista has it and its the most hated thing in Computing[/quote]

Actually that was windows ME. Even Microsoft realised it was shit and discontinued it after a year.

Windows 7 is only RC and not finished thats why there is exploits like this.

But you said IS much better, not will be. Implying that UAC 7 is already > UAC on vista.[/quote]
It is better like is to now, with Vista UAC many turn it of because of it was to annoying, now it secure a lot, except if a exploit like this run, and it will be fixed.

item.title: Microsoft ignores Windows 7 vulberability
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

A Toddler would notice how terrible is and fix it whereas Microsoft cant. How can you be so fucking ignorant. UAC was a stupid idea in the first place, XP never had it and everyone loves the operating system, Vista has it and currently its the most hated thing in Computing. If only Mircoshaft could acknowledge that their security on their operating systems are shit and introduce su/sudo.

Why don’t they have a physical switch on computers that controls access so if you are responsible to use it you can only make major system changes with a flick of a switch however retards would leave it on all the time and flash their BIOS and switch off the CPU fan.

edit:
I agree about the Win Me thing, you could hardly keep it on for an before crashing

Read full topic
